intro: Gnaphalium jujuyense, commonly known as the Jujuy everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic properties. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, and it is known for its long-lasting blooms. Gnaphalium jujuyense thrives in high-altitude environments, often found in rocky or dry soils. Its foliage is covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its arid habitat.
